games.name: AlphaGo vs Lee Sedol - Game 4: Move 78
games.description: The only game Lee Sedol won against AlphaGo. Famous for Lee's brilliant Move 78 - a move so creative that AlphaGo failed to respond properly. This move is studied as an example of human creativity defeating AI.

keyMoments.move_78: Lee Sedol's wedge at move 78 - a move with only 1 in 10,000 probability according to AlphaGo. Pure human genius!
keyMoments.move_87: AlphaGo starts making mistakes, unable to handle the unexpected position.
keyMoments.outcome: Lee Sedol's only victory in the match. Proof that humans can still surprise AI!

games.name: AlphaGo vs Ke Jie - Game 2
games.description: Peak AlphaGo performance against the world's #1 player. Ke Jie called AlphaGo 'perfect' and said this version was much stronger than the one that beat Lee Sedol.

keyMoments.opening: AlphaGo plays unconventional opening moves that pros now study.
keyMoments.midgame: Absolutely flawless play. Ke Jie said AlphaGo 'sees the future'.
keyMoments.outcome: AlphaGo Master was unbeatable. This marked the end of human dominance in Go.

games.name: The Ear-Reddening Game
games.description: Most famous game in Go history! Shusaku's Move 127 was so brilliant that a spectator's ear turned red from excitement. The move is still studied 175+ years later.

keyMoments.move_127: The legendary 'ear-reddening move'! A diagonal attachment that sealed Shusaku's victory. A doctor watching noticed his own ear turning red from the brilliance!
keyMoments.significance: This move is considered one of the greatest in Go history.
keyMoments.legacy: Shusaku was undefeated during his career. This game cemented his legend.
